intro: Buphthalmum dentatum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly toothed margin, giving it the species name "dentatum." Buphthalmum dentatum is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
